title: Beacon Chain Sync Errors
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When running `./prysm.sh beacon-chain` (version alpha16), there seems to be trouble syncing blocks; errors with stack dumps are printed. I've restarted the service several times in the last 4 days, but the same errors are still encountered. The machine was also rebooted to no effect. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? This error was not encountered with previous releases. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Simply run `./prysm.sh beacon-chain` ## üî• Error 

[2020-07-30 15:44:51]  WARN blockchain: Could not receive attestation in chain service aggregationCount=1 beaconBlockRoot=0x89f95330be30 committeeIndex=1 error=target epoch 10446 does not match current epoch 10448 or prev epoch 10447
could not process attestation

runtime.goexit

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** Ubuntu Server 20.04.1 (fully updated) **What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 1.0.0.alpha.16 **Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** Validator: 0xb282d36b2e46b888e16815daee35aa99f279cf1bd168f3621405b43896e5c4ff1fb75aa3c70c146972dfbce421b6acae

There are more output error line but it was too much.


## Environment:

### OS:

```
Debian GNU/Linux 9.13 (stretch)
```

### Prysm version:

```
beacon-chain-v1.0.0-alpha.19-linux-amd64
```

### public key:

validator:
```
0xb2d37fcffa9ea84416d7c353a9710d9a1eff8f871c1c31dad0adabd3332fdcde81beb865ea0d50193eb4c4b09228b0af
```

Hey guys, there have been significant improvements since then that optimize for memory and CPU. These issues you were seeing are related to resource constraints of your beacon node on your machine. If they still persist, please comment on here and we will reopen.
